In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code for your request:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int=10) 
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * word) > text_width
            result *= "\n" * line
            line = word
        else
            line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    return result * "\n" * line
end

# Example usage:
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit", 15))
```

This function splits the input string into words and iterates over them. It appends each word to a "line" string until this line's length exceeds the specified `text_width`. At that point, it starts a new line in the result string with the current line. This process is repeated for all words in the input string. Finally, any remaining words are added to the end of the result string after starting a new line.
